questions.question: What is the chemical formula for ROD-6?
questions.answer: [Mn2(TBAPy)(H2O)2]·DMF·H2O

questions.question: What is the difference in the coordination environment between MnII in ROD-6 and InIII in ROD-7?
questions.answer: In ROD-6, one of the MnII ions is coordinated to two H2O besides the carboxyl-O, while in ROD-7, due to the extra valency of InIII, there must be hydroxyl instead.

questions.question: What is the thermal stability range of ROD-6, and how does it compare to ROD-7?
questions.answer: ROD-6 is stable up to 485 °C, which is higher than ROD-7's stability up to 380 °C.

questions.question: How does the CO2 uptake under ambient conditions of ROD-6 compare to ROD-7 and NU-1000?
questions.answer: Under ambient conditions, the CO2 uptake capacity of ROD-6 surpasses that of ROD-7 and is comparable to that of NU-1000.

questions.question: What contributes to the high thermal stability of ROD-6?
questions.answer: The high thermal stability of ROD-6 may be contributed by the shorter pyrene–pyrene contacts, in addition to the robustness of its structure.

questions.question: Is the CO2/N2 selectivity of ROD-6 constant or does it change with CO2 loading?
questions.answer: The CO2/N2 selectivity for ROD-6 increases steadily upon loading.

questions.question: What is the underlying net of ROD-6 and how does it compare to ROD-7?
questions.answer: The underlying net of ROD-6 is lrk, while ROD-7 is frz. Both are new nets containing both rod SBUs and polytopic linkers.

questions.question: True or False: ROD-6 exhibits a type-I sorption isotherm for N2 at 77 K.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption isotherms for ROD-6 can be better fit to the dual-site Langmuir (DSL) model.
questions.answer: False, the adsorption isotherms for ROD-6 can be better fit to the single-site Langmuir (SSL) model.

questions.question: True or False: The CO2/N2 selectivity for ROD-7 becomes ineffective when the ratio of the CO2 : N2 mixture is larger than 0.5.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the role of hydroxyl groups in ROD-7's structure regarding CO2 adsorption?
questions.answer: The hydroxyl groups in ROD-7 act as weak interaction sites, presumably contributing to its CO2 adsorption behavior.

questions.question: How does the surface area of ROD-6 compare to that of NU-1000?
questions.answer: The surface area of ROD-6 is significantly lower than that of NU-1000.

questions.question: True or False: The crystalline sample of ROD-6 is resistant to hydrolysis at room temperature.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the isosteric heat of adsorption range for ROD-6, and how does it indicate the presence of interacting sites?
questions.answer: The isosteric heat of adsorption for ROD-6 ranges from 20 to 21 kJ mol-1, indicating the lack of strongly interacting sites.

questions.question: True or False: ROD-6's CO2 capture ability under ambient conditions is due to its high surface area.
questions.answer: False, ROD-6's CO2 capture ability under ambient conditions is unusual and not directly related to its moderate surface area.

questions.question: What is the formula for the ligand used in the synthesis of ROD-6 and ROD-7?
questions.answer: 1,3,6,8-tetrakis(p-benzoic acid)pyrene (H4TBAPy)

questions.question: True or False: The pyrene cores in ROD-6 and ROD-7 are arranged in the same manner.
questions.answer: False, the pyrene cores in ROD-6 are arranged within two sets of intersecting planes, while those in ROD-7 are parallel.

questions.question: What is the role of the rod SBU in the structure of ROD-6?
questions.answer: The rod SBU in ROD-6 contributes to its unusual topology and forms the framework that supports its CO2 adsorption behavior.

questions.question: True or False: The thermal stability of ROD-6 is attributed solely to the robustness of its metal-organic framework.
questions.answer: False, the thermal stability of ROD-6 may also be contributed by the shorter pyrene–pyrene contacts in addition to the robustness of its structure.

questions.question: How does the CO2/N2 selectivity of ROD-6 change with the ratio of CO2 in the gas mixture?
questions.answer: The CO2/N2 selectivity of ROD-6 increases considerably upon the increment of the CO2 ratio in the gas mixture.
